reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is great for sightseeing - it's not just for business travellers! It's right near Potsdamer Platz train station so you can take full advantage of Berlin's public transport. The staff at reception were so helpful during our stay (especially when they found out a well known airline left our suitcases in Heathrow!). Just literally round the corner there is a shopping arcade with shops, restaurants and cafes!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: Lovely! Recommend it!
reviews.title: 5 star service, excellent hotel

likes.liked: — the service was amazing and the suite was exactly how we imagined it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two friends and I are just back from a wonderful stay in the Mandala Hotel. If you want to get away to relax this it place to go, so much so that my friends and I started referring to it as "our oasis of calm". Although this Hotel does not have a big lobby it is very tastefully decorated and the suite we had was more like an apartment with bedroom, two bathrooms, a kitchenette, study/seating area and Balcony. Everything was spotlessly clean and our rooms were made up to perfection everyday. Its also in a great location, the Sony Centre is across the road and its right next to the Potsdamer Platz S Bahn and U Bahn Stations. There is also a shopping centre at the back of the Hotel.
reviews.title: A disaster waiting to happen...

likes.disliked: — Cold & impersonal - overall total absence of warmth & customer focus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've read some of the previous reviews about the staff being unfriendly, i cant believe it, they were more than lovely to us. They organised a birthday cake for my friend's birthday, gave us a free bottle of champaign, advised us about where best to go out in Berlin, gave us umbrellas for the rain, gave us dvd's to watch in our room. They greeted us and waved us goodbye everytime we went in and out of the Hotel. The service was second to none. By the third day they new all our names and on our last night we got complementary glasses of champaign at the bar.
reviews.title: Amazing, beautiful, handsome hotel

likes.liked: — The hotel overall, staff, food, location

reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant twice, once for breakfast, which was amazing and once at the Michelin star restaurant Facil which was out of this world. I've eaten in a lot of restaurants and never experienced service or food like it.
reviews.title: Cool & great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the most fabulous place to stay, 5 star quality with 5 star prices, but you get what you pay for. This was a birthday treat for my partner and we loved every minute of the hotel and Berlin. We dined in Facil (booked months in advance so that we got in) on the Friday night and what a meal.....to die for, the best service ever. The restaurant is extremely expensive, but if it is a special occasion, well worth it. Location superb and they upgraded us to a top floor room with a huge balcony. Vielen Danke Mandala, we loved you and will return.
reviews.title: Just perfect........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from Berlin after we booked two 5 day packages for this hotel through LuxuryLink. Since each package included a dinner at their restaurant (Facil) I had emailed the hotel to make certain that the reservations had been made and for which nights, as I had requested in March when I booked the stay.
reviews.title: Nice staff but very poor management

likes.liked: — The front desk staff were very helpful except when they had to contact their manager

reviews.text: Two days before we left, I received an email stating that the restaurant was closed. After a game of email tag, they wrote that they agreed to book us in another restaurant. Fine.
reviews.title: Second experience.

reviews.text: When we arrived, the staff was very nice and helpful, held our luggage for us, gave us some tips, brought us towels to freshen up, etc. Couldn't have been nicer. Then it all fell apart.
reviews.title: Spacious, well designed rooms

reviews.text: They also did not mention that the hotel was being renovated. Drilling and hammering started at 8:30 a.m. and paint fumes filled the halls to the point of giving us a headache. Also, try getting a newspaper delivered to your room. They finally got it right by the time we left.
reviews.title: Great Place To Stay in Berlin

likes.disliked: — I couldn't get a reservation at one of the restaurants, which was fully booked. Reserve in advance.

reviews.text: The Potsdamer Platz area itself is amazing, must be seen to believe the incredible modern architecture that has arisen in such a short time after the Wall came down. Well this hotel with its unassuming facade is perfect in every way, Superior location, convenient to trains, S and U Bahn, fabulous new shopping arcade and wonderful abundance of restaurants, not to mention the Sony Center, Lego Land, German Movie Museum all directly across the street. Hotel itself is ultra modern, enormous rooms, some of which have balconies, which over look a quiet inner green area. Our room for three had a separate desk/bed area for our son with his own balcony, so we lucked out with two balconies. Rooms are more than twice the size of your typical standard European hotel. Gigantic bathroom also, with bathrobes and slippers of course, good water pressure too. Didn't get a chance to eat in the restaurant, breakfast was not included , but many places nearby. Great night club around the corner, "Adagio" and Italian restaurant Essenza on corner. Would certainly return, prime location, excellent staff and hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect in every way!

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, Spaciousness, room decor, staff, prime location
likes.disliked: — There wasn't anything negative at all.

reviews.text: Great stay at the Mandala in Berlin, in the hearth of Potsdamerplatz, just in front of the Sony Center and few steps away from many cultural points and sites of interest.
reviews.title: THE MANDALA, BERLIN

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Brand new hotel with all facilities.
reviews.title: Can you imagine that some guests want to live on the 10th floor?

reviews.text: Just take note that some rooms do not have air-con, during hot season better ask for it.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and location

likes.liked: — the rooms were very spacious and had balconies.

reviews.text: Excellent breakfast in the Facil Restaurant with excellent food and service.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here over the 2007/2008 New Year and booked it primarily due to the proximity to the Brandenburg Gate (a 10-minute walk) which is the focus of the New Year (Silvester) celebrations. It was wonderful to know that we were such a short walk away at the end of the night. We also got our own personal fireworks display at our hotel window courtesy of folks on the street below.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The hotel is bang opposite the Sony Centre at Potsdamer Platz and you can easily hop on the U-bahn (underground/subway) to get to other locations like the Ku'damm for shopping/the zoo or Alexanderplatz in the east.
reviews.title: Amazing*****

reviews.text: We booked an Executive Suite at the Mandala. The room was huge, with a small kitchenette, large bedroom with desk and sofa, and a large bathroom with a big bath, perfect for wallowing in after a cold day of sightseeing. The room was stylish and modern in decor, as is the whole hotel.
reviews.title: Outstanding Business Hotel

likes.disliked: — would be good to have laundry facilities in the room (although they are available in hotel)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was included in our room, and we had it every day, in the Facil restaurant, although if we had to pay to 23 Euro charge (per person!), we would have opted to make something in our room instead. The buffet was immaculately presented, with staff constantly topping up food supplies and making sure everything was perfectly aligned (no, I'm not kidding) and all labels pointing in the right direction. You could order hot food from the staff, who all seemed to speak six languages.
reviews.title: An oasis of calm...

reviews.text: On our first night, we'd had an early start and just wanted to relax with a DVD in our room and some pizza. The staff helped us to find a DVD in English from their library (bring your own...most are German) and ordered pizza from a local restaurant for us. They were very helpful.
reviews.title: Classy Hotel in a Great Location!
